title: League insanely laggy during my first game I play when I open it, after a while it gets normal
body:
So the first game of league I play starts off extremely laggy, if I click/move my screen etc it drops from 144-5fps, so it basically runs at 5 the whole time until it slowly improves over time and eventually runs normally, at constant 144fps. The next game I play will be totally normal from start to finish. The only recent change I made to my computer was installing a pci internet card, but this happened once before I even installed that (I am 99% sure at least). I haven't made any other changes to settings, I've updated drivers, repaired league, messed with settings within league, but can't seem to find the source/problem. Anyone else experience this and have any solutions?

In case new drivers have a bug or something, I have an i5 6600k + RX 480 8GB

replies.body:
It sounds like your config might be messed up. Try following these steps: navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config and delete *game.cfg* and *persistedsettings.json* and then go into a custom game to verify. 

If that doesn't work, try updating your [video settings](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684#wq2) and see if that makes a difference with your FPS drops.

Those two steps can sometimes help with that FPS issue, but if you're still experiencing trouble, [send a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to our Tech team and we'll take a closer look at what's going on.

I deleted the config and it didn't help, it's not my video settings because a few days ago I could run max settings at like 300 fps if I wanted to, and I don't play on high settings. I've also tried repairing through the client and it didn't help either. Any other options?
